text.0: him messenger of earth and head of heaven agni vaiśvānara born in holy order.
text.1: the sage the king the guest of men a vessel fit for their mouths the gods have generated.
text.2: him have they praised midpoint of sacrifices great cistern of libations seat of riches.
text.3: vaiśvānara conveyer of oblations ensign of worship have the gods engendered.
text.4: from thee o agni springs the mighty singer from thee come heroes who subdue the foeman.
text.5: o king vaiśvānara bestow thou on us excellent treasures worthy to belonged fo r.
text.6: to thee immortal when to life thou springest all the gods sing for joy as to their infant.
text.7: they by thy mental powers were made immortal vaiśvānara when thou shonest from thy parents.
text.8: agni vaiśvānara no one hath ever resisted these thy mighty ordinances.
text.9: when thou arising from thy parents bosom foundest the light for days appointed courses.
text.10: the summits of the heaven are traversed through and through by the immortals light vaiśvānaras brilliancy.
text.11: all creatures in existence rest upon his head the seven swiftflowing streams have grown like branches forth.
text.12: vaiśvānara who measured out the realms of air sage very wise who made the lucid spheres of heaven.
text.13: the undeceivable who spread out all the worlds keeper is he and guard of immortality.
